comments.body: Oh my gosh, yes! And it makes a lot of sense, what with copper being incredibly conductive in real life.
Or you could make the powered rails craftable from either gold or copper.
100% agree especially with how common and typically useless copper is.
100 percent agree copper is incredibly lacking in uses right now and the recipe change will not only make rails cheaper and more accessible but also give copper a much needed use

Instead of being a replacement or just a stand in for gold ingots if you need to craft a powered rail, why not give it a different function? Copper rails could make Minecarts turn quickly, you put them near the edge of a turn or at turns to keep your momentum or speed up even more which means you have to use them in conjunction with gold powered rails to reach max speed (or increase the max speed to at least compete with the Elytra and Horses).
This needs to be added

Gold rail should be reworked as ‚Äúpropulsion rail‚Äù, as I believe the current rail speed should all be doubled.
If not, these propulsion rails would add +1 speed whenever the minecart passes through them, probably capping speed out at 100 m/s. After 30 m/s, minecarts colliding on entities will damage them, push past them, and reduce speed by 1 m/s. Copper rails replacing powered rails could also be used to preserve the momentum of the cart at its unoxidized state. (Powering them should deoxidize them, waxing them would preserve the state)
With the new copper update I think that this would be a great idea, and especially so if you add an easter egg so if you hit the rail with lightning its powered for 5 seconds or so.

I agree. I never use powered rail because of how much gold it takes to craft them, and I don't like gold farms. If the recipe was changed to copper, I would finally start using rail, and I would have a use for all the copper gathering dust in my storage room.

In addition to this, given how hard it is to get gold without making a giant farm, gold could be used to make an even more powerful powered rail! That way the recipe stays the same and has a bigger use in railways, but railways are still affordable

I was going to ask the same thing before I saw this. You saved me some time and made the message better. I agree with this idea, but don't change the recipe from gold to copper, make it so copper can be used as an alternative to gold, keeping gold in the recipe. It's like the lantern recipe, just change the ore and make it it's own item.
I feel like if it were added, it should have a slight pinkness
It's 2023 now. I would still like a unique wood type for the Azalea tree. It just feels wrong that we only get oak wood from Azalea trees.
YES
It should be green on the inside.
Good idea
Yo tengo la versi√≥n 1.16 y yo Quero la versi√≥n 1.17
1.17 a√∫n no ha salido. Se lanzar√° en el verano de 2021.
The dezalea wood could break if you stand on it to long.
They might add Zombie/Zombified Axolotls
Clever idea. The Darkberries will lower the light level.
And eating the darkberries will have a 15-30% chance of giving you blindness?
Instead of it being Dezalea Wood maybe it can just disintegrate and can obtained with silk touch.
It will harm you for making noise so this makes sense.
I'm sure that it's gonna do this anyways.
Are you sure? I was not so sure That'd be the case (I have no idea why).
The Warden can't see or hear anything so it can't identify what side it's on. Only through similar vibrations like the skulk sensors can the Warden be passive around.
A better example would be an enderman
ok Timothy Flamewalker
Anything except creepers
How would foliage exist underground if there is no sun there?
Kinda like the mushroom caves in terraria. I like it

Cool idea! what if there was also bioluminescent transparent mushrooms that give off enough light to allow vines to grow. (vines would only generate on or near them) as well as roots down into  the caves (just little juts of oak wood with blocks called oak roots. They make digging impossible. we hate roots!)
Adds another reason to use crossbow instead of bow
the crossbow idea is great.

Another great idea, Add a new Redstone Component related to spy glass, for example in this post

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076907911-Redstone-Projector-Balanced-Wireless-Redstone
Also, make looking through a telescope reveal more of a map when holding a map if it loads new chunks.

I had this same idea, came to see if it was already posted! However, I don't think we should allow more than one stack of arrows. Instead, I think it should be used for allowing different kinds of arrows to be placed in one inventory slot. The biggest reason enchanted arrows are unused is the massive amount of inventory space they take up if you even want 3 different kinds. This would allow us to forego that inconvenience and finally make it feasible to use different arrows on a long journey or mining trip.

That's one of the features I've always wanted! If it is going to be implemented in the future, it would be convenient if the arrows in the inventory were fired first and the arrows in the quiver were fired after the arrows in the inventory were gone.

They will probably add a recipe for calcite and tuff later on, having to find a geode in order to get them its quite a challange...perhaps that was their idea of obtaining them, but still its a great idea
Good idea! calcite can be found in geodes and/or lush caves as shown in a tweet by ladyagnes
Maybe they could sell amythiest too
Masons selling amethysts would completely ruin the point of the geodes though.
Tuff and calcite are such great building blocks, I hope they will be renewable! Perhaps they can have another use, too?

I am completely flabbergasted that they dont utilize villager trades more like this, to give players more options for obtaining hard to gather materials. If someone wants to solely trade with villagers for some items they should be able to. Half of the villagers are basically useless (leatherworker üëÄ). Even gating rarer resources behind the Wandering Trader would be an elegant solution, otherwise why is he even in the game selling common items?
I‚Äôd like to see this with almost all of the other dyed blocks too such as concrete, concrete powder, carpets, stained glass/panes, banners, and etc.
Any colored wool?

This would be very useful specially for building pixel art you wouldn't need to put out of place torches so that it could be seen at night it eould be cool if it can also be used in other colored bl9ck like concrete or terracotta
This would be a great way to introduce a bunch of new light sources into the game! I don't think colored light is in the realm of possibility, but I'd still love to see this.
Or you could just right-click a white wool with a glow ink sac in your main hand or off-hand.
It should also be made into carpets, banners, beds, etc.
Yes! we need more terrain features like this in minecraft!

With the new aquifers in the recent snapshot that allow for cave specific water levels, this same feature should be for mountain ranges as well. It would allow easily for these mountain lakes and waterfalls to be generated.
Yes! It could make things easier! You could make a laser door without the beam going all the way to the sky!
I want this so bad!

Came here to suggest this. It throws off the aesthetic of my builds!!! I think this is such a genius idea since glass already affects beacons, and tinted glass is used for blocking light. This would literally make me so happy.
This would be pretty cool, especially if you're walking around in a dark cave and hear dripping, it will make it feel like a rl cave.
This will add so much depth to the game while being such a small thing to implement.
No, just no.
Cool, but OP, so no
It would have been better and logic if it took 9x longer and the equivalent of 9 items in fuel use. Without it, it's too OP.
i agree, if it takes 9 to make the raw block or the smelted one, why can't you smelt the raw block itself?
I think it should take only 8 furnace actions instead of 9, similar to how a block of coal smelts 10 thinks instead of 9
yeah, maybe slower than smelting an ingot, so as to make it less OP
Smelting the raw blocks into 9 iron ingot,gold,copper?
It would be nice to see this in kelp blocks too. (meaning adding kelp blocks to the dried ones)
Neat idea, but perhaps for Balance, make a "Block of Coal" be a mandatory Fuel Requirement
you nailed it, post this feedback also under the pinned mountain feedback

instead of mist particles, I think it would be better for the texture to speed up as well as turn more white and opaque when falling water gets further from its last supporting block. it already checks for a supporting block to determine whether it should flow so why not use it to make the texture of falling water more realistic.
404337042552 I did along with a few other ideas, but for some reason the comment wasn't approved and by then the feedback thread was so spammed no one would have seen it if i posted it there.

Water should also have a particle effect for a higher drop: the higher the source block is from the wherever that water hits a block, should create that white, watery mist effect seen at waterfalls like Niagara Falls.
Add big caves behind the waterfalls! The waterfall should be 10x3 blocks wide
You are SSOOOOOOO RIGHT
Rare in most biomes with the exception of Deserts*
just the bundle part I get, why turtle shells?
I would soo have a villager sell me Bundles what? Unless leather is an option for the recipe, I would go to a villager, trade in my sticks, get my emeralds and buy those bundles.
They should be more expensive. Bundles should be 9 emeralds, turtle shells should be 15-20.

The amount of Emeralds or items required to obtain a Master Leatherworker is already value spend enough to what a Turtle Shell is worth it, similarly to Saddles they should also have a cheap price at max level
I love this idea! It‚Äôs a really good-thought out idea, and I agree, Leatherworkers should be used more! :)
Like netherite armor but with gold tools and copper instead. It would make it so the smithing table is not late game but rather mid game
That sounds like a cool idea

Yeah, I really like that idea, copper is a bit useless so far. The telescope not that good as players with Optifine can just zoom in and even without FOV setting are good enough. Also the border around it makes it hard to look through. Not saying its bad, I love the idea but maybe it could be a bit mores useful like idk scoped crossbow??

Ich hoffe sehr Mojang nimmt sich diese Idee zu herzen und setzt diese auch um!!!

(this comment is in German)
the speed of gold tools, but the durability of iron
Maybe we could get a fossil of mob C as a reference to the 2017 mob vote, but of course you won't be able to revive it because the other options are gone forever.
Maybe add fossils?

An archaeological fossil should be hit by lightning attracted by a lightning rod, turning the fossil into a dinosaur. the dinosaur would be the mixture of a horse (walking capacity) + donkey (carrying capacity, two chests) + dog (bodyguard)
It would be awesome if they were accurate too feather and all
it's my favorite food yummy yummy
Tbc
Tbcc
Fernando

You know that makes more sense now that I think about it

By jump i mean when it is chasing a player and its somewhere that it can't reach 

I just don't want people towering away from it

The devs did say there will be a way of preventing this exact thing

This is a good idea! The only thing I would change is I don't think it should be able to throw blocks, as it doesn't exactly seem to fit in the game for one, but also because the way you are intended to fight this mob is by throwing it off and keeping a good distance. But I do believe the warden should be able to break *most* blocks to avoid players from creating a barrier and also, maybe the longer the warden is in range of attacking you, the attack reach will begin to go up and he will eventually be able to hit you.
Being able to break blocks would also mean players couldn‚Äôt just build a horizontal row of blocks across the warden‚Äôs path and shoot it with arrows. You‚Äôve actually have to fight it!
i think that they will make the warden that u cant use a trick with him so u have to face him and thats cool remember to bring a shield
Good good  idea, just maybe not the throwing part. :)
Do it my friend said that it would be to easy but he doesn't vote so then it would be harder you can't mine up and you can't mine into the wall perfect.
Vote vote vote vote 100 votes
Don't forget your sheld
breaking blocks sounds good, dont really agree with the throwing blocks though!
Nah, seems OP. Plus it's blind so this doesn't make much sense.
Jumping and breaking block s sounds cool but not throwing

It doesn't make sense for something with the build of a warden to be good at jumping high.
Wardens should certainly be capable of jumping, but not super high. What the warden should be capable of is using shear reach and brute strength to climb towards noises and fling across over short vertical gaps when it feels them.
With the described climbing abilities the wardens would truly be terrifying foes to be avoided.
i realy want what you have sujested but there are only 31 votes if more people sall this they would vote
This is a great idea!
I think this is a great idea! Players can't tower against the warden so it is a pretty tough foe just don't let it throw active TNT!  :]

Realism is not more important than gameplay, first of all. Second of all, this doesn't really affect terraforming that much at all. Sure, you can run into caves, but most of the time it wouldn't be 2 or 3 blocks below the surface without creating an actual entrance. This is such a niche scenario honestly that is not worth changing the cave generation for when so many people are satisfied with its current state. This is just a downgrade in terms of gameplay. Exploring the surface shouldn't be encouraged through making the underground less desirable. That's just a reverse solution. Besides, the new world generation already encourages surface exploration and journeying much more than before. Finally, building underground structures has mostly become easier under the right conditions. You can find mega-caves over 40 blocks high, and in the case of the more common medium caves, Moss Blocks + Bone Meal + Hoe = Instant Mining. Also scaffolding exists if you want to deal with high areas or pillars. There are so many ways you can deal with this, including a new incredibly effective one through the new blocks; making the underground less interesting is a one-way solution.

Not only the underground but the surface also feels like swiss cheese with the new cave generation, and reducing the cave frequency/density a little bit wouldn't reduce how interesting the underground is, it just would mean you don't need to fill in 10 huge cave holes any time you want to build a base and don't want to dodge cave holes everywhere you walk. The underground does not need to be more cave than ground to be just as interesting. You can still have all the new caves and their glorious chambers and networks, without them opening up so many holes on the surface.

I do like the new caves, if only they didn't make so many holes on the surface!

Yes! I dislike the fact that I can‚Äôt run around without being scared I‚Äôm going to fall through a hole and die and lose all my stuff because it‚Äôs at the center of the earth. The update is definitely cool, but the caves and caverns need to spawn less, and farther between. And maybe make it that the entrances are large, not little 4x4 holes that you can just drop through because you didn‚Äôt see the larger entrance nearby. It‚Äôs making exploring and mining very difficult.

Yes please!!! It's unplayable with giant holes and ravines only few blocks apart! And not to mention you have to be very lucky to find lakes and rivers that AREN'T intersected by ravines and holes!!! Updates since aquatic added lots of visual fluff and new building options which is great, but never fixed, instead worsened existing problems like siwss cheese caves and bad biome transitions!

Yes, I also think there are too many caves. There should be a greater distance between each large cave. But now the whole world is a karst landform leading to the center of the earth, which is a nightmare for building cities.

I'd also like the amount of caves decreased significantly, mainly because after the first few minutes of playing the new update the massive caves don't feel special anymore, because they're absolutely everywhere! I love the look and feel of the giant caves don't get me wrong, but if they are to maintain the sense of wonder they definitely need to be rarer. I also share the notion of disliking the swiss chees appearance of the surface. Not only does it make exploring quite dangerous but it ruins the aesthetics of the beautiful mountains, plains and rivers when they're always cut in half by massive caverns. Again, it's cool to see every now and then, but not every 100 blocks or so.

I'm not sure if it's possible to easily edit the world generation with data packs or mods or similar to reduce large cave frequency, but I'd happily settle for that over a full update to the game.

Caves are great. But, the way they are currently generated is definitely not great and I haven't played a current Minecraft version since they were implemented. The way are generated now is over the top and needs to be dialed back a decent amount. If you go into spectator and look around underground, it's just ridiculous. I haven't been able to enjoy anything in the game since 1.16.5, 15 minutes and I've had it and I'm out. I realize that most people don't care and won't say anything if they do, but, it's just too much.

Caves in the sides of hills, flatter farmland, caves suppressed in flatter terrain.

More caves on hills, and **mountains**!!! Mountains don't have half enough cave mouths!
I feel the same, but rather than changing the current default behaviour, it would be nice to have this as a configurable option in the world generation settings.

The hollow earth design and constant cliff sized hills make survival a nightmare. I‚Äôm constantly worried about falling in a hole, off a cliff, or how long it‚Äôs going to take me to scale a mountain because there was a river cutting through basic biomes generated too high up.
I feel that the frequency of caves can be reduced by about 50%. Like the insane amount of cave entrances just destroys the surface of the Minecraft world.
Not even possible. They're coded in entirely different coding languages. It's not about the accounts.

Servers and mods work on emulating the code from each platform. It is a really complex situation. I don't know a lot of the details about the coding process, and I haven't really tested it. I don't know if they could do that with the base game. Joining a server is not like joining a private world or Realm, that's for sure. It might be extremely tedious to do, but it might work.
I agree, and Xisumatwo did prove it possible
Make Java and bedrock the same game it‚Äôs weird having two different Minecraft with different Mechanics

You can use modded server software such as GeyserMC for crossplay between Java and Bedrock, however it is not perfect. For example, a Java player could put a crafting table in their offhand, while a Bedrock player on the same server cannot.
–≠—Ç–æ –æ—Ç–ª–∏—á–Ω–∞—è –∏–¥–µ—è!
It would be cool to hear wind howling the higher you go
I really like this idea. You should hear freezing wind, falling rocks, cracking ice and howling of wolfs etc.
Would be cool if you would hear wisling winds during snow or thunderstorm
you should also hear birds though there are currently non in extreme hills
If they make these, we won't need to use lightning rods anymore too!
I want this so I don‚Äôt have to spend a fortune on hoppers!

I think this is a great idea because i would love to see automation for lava farming, if the pipes were like hoppers but with fluids and reacted to redstone like hoppers and could suck lava out of cauldrons then we would have an automatic lava farm. I think it is great because while we have renewable lava we do not have the procces automatic.

I don't think automated lava farming should be possible with this, because the lava would just melt the pipes. I know the lava doesn't melt the cauldrons, but copper pipes are thinner than cauldron walls and copper and has a lower melting point than iron so it just FEELS wrong.

Overall, I preferred this idea for how copper pipes could work in conjunction with hoppers to transport items:
https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360076184872-Copper-Pipes-infographic-included-

For water flow control or water transport, I'd rather see Minecraft give bamboo some love and give it a unique use, since it's early-game accessible and currently has so few uses. Copper within redstone contraptions feels OK, but copper water pipes and fish or lava transport feel a bit too modern for the world of Minecraft when you could do those things other ways. It starts feeling like you're using a technical mod.
I would like to see copper pipes be able to extend and direct the output from hoppers

We need copper pipes. Hoppers aren't meant to transport items and they work under several limitations (like transporting items upwards). Also that would add a much need use to copper (lightning rods aren't used much for their actual purpose by users as they skip thunderstorms by sleeping and also the Zoom feature of Optifine). Also hoppers are vey costly and laggy if they are used a lot.
This and a red stone powered water pump so that the water reacts the same as red stone does when stretched out
THIS IS GOING TO BE VERY GOOD FOR THE GAME. I AGREE.
This sounds great! I don't think this should be a thing in deserts or plains though, because those biomes are generally desired for building because of their flat terrain.

398830310812 100%. The screenshots I took are mostly of bumpy or interesting terrain, but there's still a lot of flatness. Since biomes have their own noise scale factor, even with this change, plains and deserts biomes will always be flatter and lower than, say a forest or mountains biome.
Yes! It is good to get as many things from Minecraft Earth into Minecraft as possible before it closes down. Also, can it drop a new color of wool? Perhaps beige?

Umbra Cow is good idea, but no rare variant.
Perfect spawn place: Dark Forest

Yaaaasss! I really like this idea! I really hope we get this in the game! Maybe you can sheer it like a sheep but get hair. Then you can use the hair to make a coat that prevents you from freezing (instead of leather)
I‚Äôm don‚Äôt think umbra cows should be a separate mob, In the source game they are also a variant of the wooly cow.

406389604811

They could do that, but I don‚Äôt think that‚Äôs a good idea either. Only leather should prevent freezing so leather has a use. Nobody used it in survival due to the fact that it‚Äôs so weak and iron can be found faster. It was (almost) only used in minigames. With this update they finally gave leather armor to exist for survival players. (in 1.16 this was gold armor)
